meanings.definition: To house or keep (a dog) in a kennel.
meanings.sent1: She kennelled her puppy at night to keep it safe.
meanings.sent2: The dog was kennelled while the family went on vacation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kennelled itself in the laundry basket.
meanings.sent4: His fear kennelled him in a state of paralysis.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind kennelled the sound of the approaching storm.

meanings.definition: To confine or restrict (someone or something) to a small space.
meanings.sent1: The magician kennelled the rabbit in a tiny hat.
meanings.sent2: The prisoners were kennelled in cramped cells.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing closet kennelled her favorite shoes.
meanings.sent4: His anxiety kennelled him in a cycle of worry.
meanings.sent5: The dense fog kennelled visibility, making it hard to see.
